main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a bright light come out of a cloud, hover over a house, and then move upward and to the right before disappearing back into the cloud near Cape Vincent, New York on November 6, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as circular in shape, with a hazy or whitish color, and approximately 50 feet in diameter.
The sighting lasted for 1 to 1.5 minutes.
The weather conditions were partly cloudy with light winds under 5 mph and good visibility.
The sighting was reported to the local police, and the sheriff investigated and took statements from the witnesses.
The investigating officer at the local level concluded that the observer was watching flares being fired at Camp Drum at the time.
